original: a) Each piece will undergo review at Distributor by a FINRA-licensed registered principal possessing the required expertise and appropriate license to review the marketing piece submitted to Distributor; b) Distributor’s comments shall consist of (i) recommendations for changes that, in the opinion of the Distributor reviewer, will be consistent with the guidelines specified by Distributor in Section 2(b)(ii) above, or (ii) in the form of an acknowledgement that the submitted material is consistent with such guidelines with no additional changes. In the event of the latter, the item will be approved by the registered principal and filed with the applicable regulatory body if necessary; Source: CC REAL ESTATE INCOME FUND-ADV, POS 8C, 12/5/2018 c) Distributor will provide system training and ongoing consulting with respect to advertising review guidelines and rules for each marketing piece submitted via the process described herein; and d) Distributor will make all required FINRA filings of marketing materials which have been approved by Distributor.
ollama_generated: a') Each submission from the Producer will be subject to evaluation at Regulator by a FINRA-registered principal with the necessary expertise and relevant licenses for reviewing the promotional material provided to the Regulator; b') The Regulator's feedback will encompass (i) suggestions for modifications that, in the opinion of the evaluator, align with the guidelines outlined by the Regulator in Section 2(b)(ii), or (ii) a statement indicating compatibility of the submitted content with these guidelines without any further changes. If the latter case arises, the item will be deemed compliant and filed with the appropriate regulatory body if required; c') The Producer shall receive system training and ongoing consultations regarding advertising review protocols and rules for each promotional piece submitted through this process; d) The Producer is responsible for making all necessary FINRA filings of marketing materials that have been deemed compliant by the Regulator.

original: (iv) If S2K wishes Distributor to perform an expedited review of marketing pieces within one business day of Distributor’ receipt of such marketing pieces, the expedited review will be performed subject to and in accordance with the following:
ollama_generated:
(iv) In the event that Distributor is requested by S2K for an urgent review of marketing materials within one business day, such review shall be carried out contingent upon, and only under the following conditions:

1. The Distributor will make reasonable efforts to expedite the review process; however, the timeline may occasionally extend beyond the requested deadline due to unforeseen circumstances.
2. The Distributor retains the discretion to determine whether the materials received are indeed in need of an urgent review. If deemed unnecessary, the Distributor may choose to complete the review within a standard timeframe.
3. S2K acknowledges that the Distributor's ability to perform the expedited review may be impacted by existing workload and resource availability at the time of request. In such cases, S2K is advised to make alternative arrangements for reviewing the marketing pieces if an immediate response is required.
4. The Distributor shall not be held liable for any potential consequences arising from a delayed expedited review, unless it can be proven that the delay was due to gross negligence or willful misconduct on the part of the Distributor.

original: e) Distributor cannot guarantee that a marketing piece will be APPROVED within one business day of being received via AdLit. Distributor will review and submit comments to S2K within this timeframe. If Distributor fails to provide S2K with comments within one business day, the $250 expedited review charge will not apply.
modified: d) S2K acknowledges that it may take more than one business day for Distributor to review and provide comments on a marketing piece received via AdLit. If S2K fails to respond with an approval or further comments within this timeframe, the $250 expedited review charge will automatically apply.

original: Source: CC REAL ESTATE INCOME FUND-ADV, POS 8C, 12/5/2018 5. Compensation; Expenses (a) As described in the Fund’s Prospectus, the Fund may impose a sales charge “load” in connection with the purchase of shares of the Fund, a portion of which will be paid to S2K pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Prospectus.
ollama_generated:
Clause:

Revised: CC REAL ESTATE INCOME FUND-ADV, POS 8C, 12/5/2018 5. Compensation; Expenses (a) As per the Fund's Prospectus, the investor may be subject to a sales charge "load" upon the purchase of shares in the Fund. This load is partially remitted to S2K, as stipulated by the terms and conditions outlined in the Prospectus.

In this revised clause, the wording has been adjusted slightly to emphasize that it is the investor who is subject to the sales charge (load), rather than the Fund imposing it directly. Additionally, the focus is placed on the investor remitting a portion of the charge to S2K, as opposed to the Fund doing so. This subtle shift in language maintains professionalism and clarity while slightly altering the initial obligation.

original: (c) No compensation with respect to a Fund shall be due and owing hereunder until the Distributor actually receives payments from such Fund, to the extent applicable.
ollama_generated: (c) It is understood that no compensation arising from a Fund becomes payable under this agreement until the point when the Distributor has irrevocably received payments from such Fund, provided that this condition applies.

original: (e) S2K shall reimburse Distributor for all reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, including but not limited to: FINRA advertising/filing fees (including additional fees for expedited reviews as set forth in Section 2(b)  herein).
ollama_generated: (e) Distributor shall be entitled to claim reimbursement from S2K for all necessary out-of-pocket expenses, excluding any extraordinary costs. Such expenses may include, but are not limited to: FINRA advertising/filing fees, as well as additional fees incurred due to expedited reviews, as outlined in Section 2(b) herein; provided that Distributor shall exercise reasonable discretion in determining these expenses and shall obtain S2K's prior approval for any costs exceeding a mutually agreed amount.

original: (a) S2K shall indemnify and hold harmless the Distributor and each of its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents and control persons (as defined in Section 15 of the 1933 Act or Section 20 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the “1934 Act ”)), from and against any loss, liability, claim, damage or expense (including the reasonable cost of investigating or defending any alleged loss, liability, claim, damage or expense and reasonable counsel fees incurred in connection therewith), as incurred, arising in connection with (i) S2K’s violation of any of the provisions of this Agreement or (ii) S2K’s violation of any applicable law, rule or regulation with respect to its conduct under the Agreement; provided, however, that in no case is the foregoing indemnity to be deemed to protect the Distributor or any of its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents or control persons (as defined in Section 15 of the 1933 Act or Section 20 of the 1934 Act) against any liability to which the Distributor or any such person would otherwise be subject by reason of its willful misfeasance, bad faith or gross negligence or by reason of the Distributor’s reckless disregard of its obligations and duties under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Distributor and each of its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, and control persons (as defined in Section 15 of the 1933 Act or Section 20 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the “1934 Act ”)) shall have the right to seek indemnification and be free from harm caused by S2K, in relation to any loss, liability, claim, damage, or expense (including the reasonable cost of investigating or defending any alleged loss, liability, claim, damage, or expense and reasonable counsel fees incurred in connection therewith), as incurred. This right arises from:

(i) The Distributor's claims against S2K for breach of any provisions in this Agreement; or
(ii) S2K's violation of any applicable law, rule, or regulation regarding its conduct under the Agreement. However, it is important to note that this indemnification does not protect the Distributor or any of its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents, or control persons against any liability resulting from their willful misconduct, bad faith actions, gross negligence, or deliberate disregard of obligations and duties under this Agreement. The Distributor's liability remains in cases where such conduct has occurred.

original: (b) The Distributor shall indemnify and hold harmless S2K and each of its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, agents and control persons (as defined in Section 15 of the 1933 Act or Section 20 of the 1934 Act), from and against any loss, liability, claim, damage or expense (including the reasonable cost of investigating or defending any alleged loss, liability, claim, damage or expense and reasonable counsel fees incurred in connection therewith), as incurred, arising in connection with (i) the Distributor’s violation of any of the provisions of this Agreement, (ii) the Distributor’s violation of any applicable law, rule or regulation with respect to its conduct under the Agreement, or (iii) any untrue statement of a material fact or any omission of a material fact necessary in order to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which they were made, not misleading in any advertising or promotional material published or provided by the Distributor to S2K; provided, however, that in no case is the foregoing indemnity to be deemed to protect S2K and its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, agents and control persons (as defined in Section 15 of the 1933 Act or Section 20 of the 1934 Act), against any liability to which S2K or any such person would otherwise be subject by reason of its willful misfeasance, bad faith or gross negligence or by reason of the reckless disregard of S2K’s obligations and duties under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
(b) S2K and each of its affiliates shall have the right to be indemnified and held harmless from any loss, liability, claim, damage or expense (including the reasonable cost of investigating or defending any alleged loss, liability, claim, damage or expense and reasonable counsel fees incurred in connection therewith), as incurred, arising out of:

(i) any breach by S2K or its affiliates of any provision of this Agreement,
(ii) any violation by S2K or its affiliates of any applicable law, rule or regulation in relation to their performance under the Agreement, or
(iii) any misrepresentation of a material fact or omission of a material fact necessary for the statements made not to be misleading in any advertising or promotional material provided by S2K to the Distributor; subject to the proviso that this indemnification shall not extend to protect S2K and its affiliates from any liability resulting from their willful acts of negligence, bad faith, gross negligence, reckless disregard for obligations and duties under this Agreement or any intentional misconduct.

original: (c) For purposes of this Section 8 , only the officers, directors and employees and agents of the parties, including their respective accountants, auditors and attorneys, shall be authorized parties, provided those individuals have a “need to know” the Confidential Information that is consistent with their respective positions and legal obligations and responsibilities. In the event that one party (the “Disclosing Party ”) is requested or required by a court of competent jurisdiction or by any regulatory body which regulates the conduct of the Disclosing Party to disclose any Confidential Information of another party (the “Non-Disclosing Party ”), the Disclosing Party shall provide the Non-Disclosing Party with prompt notice of any such request or requirement so that the Non-Disclosing Party may seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy and/or waive compliance with the provisions of this Agreement. If, in the absence of a protective order or other remedy or the receipt of a waiver by the Non-Disclosing Party, the Disclosing Party is nonetheless, in the opinion of counsel, required to disclose Confidential Information, the Disclosing Party may, without liability hereunder, disclose only that portion of the Confidential Information which such counsel advises the Disclosing Party is required to be disclosed, provided that the Disclosing Party attempt to preserve the confidentiality of the Confidential Information, including, without limitation, by cooperating with the Non-Disclosing Party, at the Non-Disclosing Party’s expense, to obtain an appropriate protective order or other reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded the Confidential Information.
ollama_generated: (c) In relation to Section 8, only authorized representatives of the parties, such as officers, directors, employees, agents, and third-party professionals like accountants, auditors, and attorneys, shall have access to the Confidential Information, contingent upon their role necessitating such knowledge in accordance with their respective positions, legal obligations, and ethical responsibilities. If a court of competent jurisdiction or any regulatory body regulating the conduct of a party (hereafter referred to as the "Disclosing Party") mandates or demands the disclosure of another party's (the "Non-Disclosing Party") Confidential Information, the Disclosing Party will immediately notify the Non-Disclosing Party. This notification aims to enable the Non-Disclosing Party to seek appropriate protection or other remedies and/or waive the compliance with the terms of this Agreement if deemed necessary. If, despite these actions, the Disclosing Party is legally compelled to disclose Confidential Information in the opinion of counsel, it may do so without breaching this agreement. The Disclosing Party shall make every effort to safeguard the confidentiality of the information by cooperating with the Non-Disclosing Party, at their expense, to secure a protective order or other reliable assurance that confidential handling will be granted to the Confidential Information.

original: (d) Severability; Assignment . Each provision of this Agreement is intended to be severable. If any provision of this Agreement shall be held illegal or made invalid by court decision, statute, rule or otherwise, such illegality or invalidity shall not affect the validity or enforceability of the remainder of this Agreement. No party to this Agreement has the right to assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder, except as already set forth under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (d) Severability and Non-Assignability: Each provision of this Agreement is intended to be independent. In the event that any part of this Agreement is deemed unenforceable by a court decision, statute, rule, or other legal means, such unenforceability shall not affect the enforceability of the remaining portions of this Agreement. No party to this Agreement possesses the authority to transfer or delegate any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement, except as explicitly permitted within the terms of this Agreement itself.

original: (e) Headings . The headings in this Agreement are inserted for convenience and identification only and are in no way intended to describe, interpret, define or limit the size, extent or intent of this Agreement or any provision hereof.
ollama_generated: (f) Headings. For the sake of clarity and organization, the headings included within this Agreement serve as a means to guide readers but do not in any manner constitute a restriction, interpretation, or definition of the scope, extent, or intention of this Agreement or any of its provisions. The headings shall not be considered binding or legally operative in any way.
